commonPatterns.name: primary-action
commonPatterns.description: Single most important action on the page

commonPatterns.name: default-action
commonPatterns.description: Standard action — most commonly used variant

commonPatterns.name: icon-and-text
commonPatterns.description: Button with leading icon and text label

commonPatterns.name: icon-only
commonPatterns.description: Compact icon-only button for toolbars or inline actions

commonPatterns.name: destructive-confirmation
commonPatterns.description: High-impact or irreversible action requiring emphasis

commonPatterns.name: button-pair
commonPatterns.description: Primary + outline pairing for confirm/cancel flows

antiPatterns.scenario: Multiple primary buttons on one page
antiPatterns.reason: Confuses visual hierarchy and user decision-making
antiPatterns.alternative: Use one primary button; others should be outline or ghost

antiPatterns.reason: Buttons trigger actions, links navigate — mixing them breaks semantics and accessibility
The secondary variant is forbidden in this design system
antiPatterns.alternative: Use outline for standard actions or ghost for low-emphasis

antiPatterns.reason: Users must have clear visual warning before irreversible actions
antiPatterns.alternative: Always use the destructive variant for delete, remove, or irreversible operations

semanticMeaning.primary: Single most important action on a page
semanticMeaning.link: Inline text-level action styled as a hyperlink

iconOnly.description: Renders as a square button for icon-only use

composition.asChild: Supports Radix Slot via asChild prop to render as a different element

interactions.hover: Subtle background shift; primary/outline/secondary gain elevation shadow
interactions.active: Translates down 0.5px and flattens shadow to simulate press

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Space/Enter to activate; Tab to navigate
accessibility.screenReader: Announces button label, variant is visual-only
accessibility.focusManagement: Visible 3px focus ring on focus-visible, ring color matches variant

rules: Only one primary button per page
Destructive actions must use destructive variant
Buttons may be used inline when action intent is clear
Never use the secondary variant — it is forbidden in this design system

aiHints.context: Use for any interactive action that changes state or triggers behavior. Default to outline variant unless the action is the single most important on the page (primary) or destructive.
